tool.name: Ensemble_Masker

param.name: in_ensemble_nc_path
param.dialogReference: A Ensemble NetCDF generated by the Ensemble Model module. Requires x and y dimensions with at least one variable.

param.name: in_mask_file_path
param.displayname: Input mask NetCDF or GeoTIFF file
param.dialogReference: A Digital Elevation Model (DEM) or Canopy Height Model (CHM) NetCDF or GeoTiff raster file.

param.name: out_masked_nc_path
param.dialogReference: The folder location and filename of the output NetCDF file containing masked Ensemble NetCDF.

param.name: in_min_value
param.dialogReference: The minimum value in the input Mask file to include as valid in the Ensemble NetCDF. Anything under this value will be masked out of the Ensemble NetCDF.

param.name: in_max_value
param.dialogReference:
The maximum value in the input Mask file to include as valid in the Ensemble NetCDF. Anything above this value will be masked out of the EnsembleNetCDF.

Note: Leave this blank to only mask values using the minimum value.

param.name: in_replacement_value
param.dialogReference: The value to use to replace masked out pixels in the Ensemble NetCDF. The default is set to 0, which represents "no habitat" within the Ensemble NetCDF.

tool.summary: Mask out areas of the Ensemble model output NetCDF using another NetCDF or GeoTIFF. This module was created to allow users to take a Canopy Height Model (CHM) and remove areas of the Ensemble based on vegetation canopy height (e.g., remove all potential species habitat where vegetation canopy height is less than two metres). However, any layer can be used in input to act as a mask.

dataIdInfo.idCredit: Lewis Trotter, Todd Robinson, Curtin University, FrontierSI, Digital Earth Australia, Geoscience Australia
